body: You probably would want to use an IntIntMap instead of ObjectMap<Integer, Integer>.
Again - thanks for the information, MobiDevelop, it's good to know we have a class like that... Java collections lacked that one. I edited both my code and the gist to use IntIntMap instead.

issue.title: fixes missing keycodes, cleans up & sorts existing ones - an essential/p...
issue.body: ...rerequisite commit for further Input improvements, e.g. https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/2524

body: And again i was bitten by trusting a PR. Your PR for this issue killed Backspace and other keycodes.

As a part of my "redemption", I'll write a test making sure that all the previous codes are present and include it in the fixed Input.java PR, would that be OK? NB should have done that in the first place...

BTW, even if that commit _was_ 100% OK, it would still not solve this particular issue - it would only _allow_ to solve it, as it would still require updating backends (LWJGL, JGLFW, GWT namely) to match, support & recognize all the new codes.
@CreamyCookie did you test if it was fixed? I'll assume so, also since no one else has complained and it's been years.

@NathanSweet actually: no, it wasn't. See https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/blob/master/gdx/src/com/badlogic/gdx/Input.java for yourself. The relevant PR is https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/pull/2592 - but yes, it's been years. [Years from those golden years.](https://trends.google.co.uk/trends/explore?date=all&q=libgdx)

Still no non-numeric numpad, no Num/Caps/ScrollLock, no SysRq and no Break. http://www.grumpynerd.com/?p=132

@NathanSweet Sorry, I thought this was fixed because the pull request #2592 was closed, but looking at it now, it apparently wasn't merged, only closed. Again, I want to apologize for any inconvenience I may have caused. Please re-open this issue.

@Tom-Ski Do you know why #2592 was closed at the time? There was no explanation given on that pull request.
It was closed because the user that submitted the PR deleted their account before it was reviewed.

Ah.. that means the patch can't be used because of legal reasons , right?

 [Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/wiki/Contributing) needs to be signed
